thread.section_title: Airwise - The Airport and Air Travel Guide
thread.title: Delta Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Hail
thread.title_full: Delta Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Hail | Airwise News

author: Reuters
title: Delta Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Hail
text:
A Delta airliner flying from Boston to Salt Lake City encountered a hail storm and was forced to make an emergency landing in Denver. Photos taken by a passenger and posted on the website of Salt Lake City television station KSTU showed cracks in the cockpit window and damage to its nose cone.
Delta flight 1889 landed safely at Denver Airport on Friday night after encountering the hail, and the incident is under investigation, an FAA spokesman said.
Laura Coale, a spokeswoman for Denver Airport, said one passenger on the plane requested to be transported to a local hospital.
The plane originated in Boston and had been bound for Salt Lake City before it was diverted, Gregor said.
"I fly constantly and this was the scariest 10 minutes of my life," passenger Robin Jones told KSTU after arriving at Salt Lake Airport.
(Reuters)
